meta.note: Plans are 7 days starting from 'today'. Backend maps survey -> buckets -> selects one plan deterministically per week unless user requests refresh.

plans.title: Reset & Ground: 7 Days to Calm the Nervous System
plans.summary: A gentle plan designed for high stress and low sleep quality. You’ll practice short grounding meditations, micro-breaks, and simple routines to reduce anxiety and stabilize your day.

days.headline: Day 1 — Stabilize your baseline
days.microExercise: 60-second shoulder drop: inhale lift shoulders, exhale release. Repeat 5 times.
days.reflection: Write one sentence: ‘Right now, I’m safe enough to take the next small step.’
days.habit: Pick ONE anchor habit: drink water after waking, or open a window for 1 minute.

days.headline: Day 2 — Breath as a safety signal
days.meditation: Box breathing 4-4-4-4 for 5 rounds + 3 minutes body scan.
days.microExercise: Name 5 things you see, 4 you feel, 3 you hear, 2 you smell, 1 you taste.
days.reflection: What was the first sign of stress today? (A thought? A body sensation?)
days.habit: Caffeine boundary: avoid caffeine 90 minutes after waking (if possible).

days.headline: Day 3 — Calm the body first
days.meditation: Progressive muscle relaxation (hands → shoulders → face → legs).
days.microExercise: 2-minute slow walk: feel heel-to-toe contact, don’t rush.
days.reflection: Rate stress (0–10). What reduces it by even 1 point?
days.habit: Evening wind-down: dim screens 30 minutes earlier (or use night mode).

days.headline: Day 4 — Unhook from anxious thoughts
days.meditation: Thought labeling: ‘planning’, ‘worrying’, ‘judging’, then return to breath.
days.microExercise: Write the main worry on paper. Add: ‘My mind is having the thought that…’
days.reflection: What is within my control today? List 2 small actions.
days.habit: 1 boundary: say ‘no’ to one non-essential task or shorten it by 10%.

days.headline: Day 5 — Build self-compassion
days.meditation: Loving-kindness for self: ‘May I be safe. May I be calm. May I be kind to myself.’
days.microExercise: Hand-on-heart + 6 slow breaths.
days.reflection: What would I tell a friend in the same situation?
days.habit: Add one supportive input: short stretch, warm tea, or a 5-min tidy.

days.headline: Day 6 — Reduce overload
days.meditation: Open awareness: notice sounds, sensations, thoughts without chasing them.
days.microExercise: Notification diet: disable 1 non-essential notification for 24 hours.
days.reflection: What drains me most? What’s one tiny adjustment I can try?
days.habit: Micro-plan: choose your top 3 tasks only. Everything else is optional.

days.headline: Day 7 — Integration & next-week plan
days.meditation: Full body scan + 3 minutes gratitude for effort (not outcomes).
days.microExercise: Plan a 10-minute recovery block for tomorrow (walk, stretch, or quiet time).
days.reflection: Which practice helped most? Commit to repeating it 3× next week.
days.habit: Sleep support: pick a fixed ‘lights-off’ target time and protect it.

plans.title: Sleep Reset Week: Build a Calm Evening Routine
plans.summary: A practical 7-day plan to improve sleep quality with short meditations, evening rituals, and daytime behaviors that support better rest.

days.headline: Day 1 — Set the foundation
days.microExercise: Make your room 5% more sleep-friendly (tidy, dim light, cool air).
days.reflection: What time do I realistically want to be in bed?
days.habit: No screens for the last 10 minutes before sleep.

days.headline: Day 2 — Consistent wake time
days.meditation: Morning intention: 2 minutes + 6 minutes mindful breathing.
days.microExercise: Get daylight exposure for 5–10 minutes after waking.
days.reflection: How does light affect my energy today?
days.habit: Pick a fixed wake time (±30 min) and keep it.

days.headline: Day 3 — Reduce late stimulation
days.microExercise: Caffeine cutoff: stop 8 hours before target bedtime.
days.reflection: What triggers late-night scrolling for me?
days.habit: Create a ‘phone parking spot’ outside the bed.

days.headline: Day 4 — Calm the mind
days.microExercise: Brain dump: write tomorrow’s worries/tasks for 3 minutes.
days.reflection: What thought repeats most at night?
days.habit: Warm shower or face wash as a ‘sleep cue’.

days.headline: Day 5 — Relax the body
days.microExercise: Gentle neck stretch 60 seconds per side.
days.reflection: Where do I store tension?
days.habit: Add one calming scent or soft lighting in the evening.

days.headline: Day 6 — Build recovery buffers
days.microExercise: Take a 10-minute walk during the day to reduce sleep pressure issues.
days.reflection: What helps me feel ‘done’ with the day?
days.habit: Stop heavy meals 2–3 hours before sleep (if possible).

days.headline: Day 7 — Lock the routine
days.meditation: Longer body scan + gratitude for effort.
days.microExercise: Plan next week’s evening routine in 3 bullet points.
days.reflection: Which change improved sleep the most?
days.habit: Commit to repeating the top 2 habits for 7 more days.

plans.title: Focus Sprint: 7 Days of Attention Training
plans.summary: Train your attention like a muscle. Short meditations + practical deep-work rituals to improve focus without burnout.

days.headline: Day 1 — Attention baseline
days.meditation: Focused attention on breath (count 1–10, restart on distraction).
days.microExercise: Set a 25-min focus block today (Pomodoro).
days.reflection: What distracts me most: phone, tabs, or thoughts?
days.habit: Single-task rule for the first 15 minutes of work.

days.headline: Day 2 — Reduce context switching
days.microExercise: Close 5 unnecessary tabs; keep 1 task visible.
days.reflection: What task deserves my best attention today?
days.habit: Check messages only twice (set two time windows).

days.headline: Day 3 — Build deep work
days.meditation: Body + breath anchor switching (2 minutes each).
days.microExercise: Do a 40-min deep-work block with phone out of reach.
days.reflection: How did my energy change after deep work?
days.habit: Start your day with the hardest task for 10 minutes.

days.headline: Day 4 — Train recovery
days.meditation: Open awareness (let stimuli come and go).
days.microExercise: Two 2-minute breaks: stand, breathe, look far away.
days.reflection: What does ‘good break’ look like for me?

days.headline: Day 5 — Working with resistance
days.microExercise: Do the task for 5 minutes even if you don’t feel like it.
days.reflection: What story do I tell myself when I avoid tasks?

days.headline: Day 6 — Focus & stress balance
days.meditation: Slow exhale breathing + brief body scan.
days.microExercise: Plan tomorrow: 3 priorities, 1 optional.
days.reflection: What’s one thing I can simplify?

days.headline: Day 7 — Integration
days.meditation: Longer focused attention + gratitude for effort.
days.microExercise: Choose your ‘default focus routine’ for next week.
days.reflection: Which technique worked best? Counting, noting, or rituals?
days.habit: Commit to 3 focus blocks next week.

plans.title: Resilience Maintenance: Calm + Clarity
plans.summary: You’re already in a good place. This week maintains low stress and sharpens clarity with slightly deeper practice.

days.headline: Day 1 — Clarity scan
days.meditation: Open awareness: track sensations, sounds, thoughts.
days.microExercise: Write your top value for the week in one sentence.
days.reflection: Where do I overcomplicate?

days.headline: Day 2 — Precision attention
days.microExercise: 60-second posture reset each hour.
days.reflection: What is the smallest ‘high leverage’ action today?

days.headline: Day 3 — Emotional agility
days.microExercise: Name the emotion + what it needs (one word each).
days.reflection: What emotion did I avoid? How did it show up?

days.headline: Day 4 — Compassion & boundaries
days.microExercise: One clear boundary message (short, kind, direct).
days.reflection: Where do I leak energy?

days.headline: Day 5 — Deep rest
days.meditation: Yoga nidra style body scan (guided or silent).
days.microExercise: No phone for first 10 minutes after waking.
days.reflection: What does ‘rest’ mean for me today?

days.headline: Day 6 — Meaningful focus
days.microExercise: Do one meaningful task before checking messages.
days.reflection: What do I want to feel by end of day?

days.headline: Day 7 — Weekly review
days.microExercise: Review: keep / improve / remove (3 bullets).
days.reflection: What habit should become my default?

plans.title: Confidence Week: Small Practices, Big Calm
plans.summary: A beginner-friendly plan to reduce anxiety through short daily skills that build confidence and stability.

days.headline: Day 1 — Start small
days.microExercise: Write one tiny win you can achieve today.
days.reflection: What do I need most: rest, clarity, or support?

days.headline: Day 2 — Calm cue
days.microExercise: Create a calm cue (touch thumb + index) for stress moments.
days.reflection: When did I feel most tense today?

days.headline: Day 3 — Body comfort
days.microExercise: Stretch: neck + shoulders 2 minutes.
days.reflection: Which body area asks for care?

days.headline: Day 4 — Thought distance
days.microExercise: Write: ‘I notice I’m having the thought that…’
days.reflection: What would be a more helpful thought?

days.headline: Day 5 — Self-kindness
days.microExercise: Put a hand on heart, 5 breaths.
days.reflection: What would compassion do here?
days.habit: Replace one harsh self-talk with a neutral statement.

days.headline: Day 6 — Reduce overload
days.microExercise: Say no to one small request (or delay it).
days.reflection: What can wait 24 hours?

days.headline: Day 7 — Your calm toolkit
days.meditation: Choose your best practice and repeat it longer.
days.microExercise: Write a 3-step calm plan for stressful moments.
days.reflection: Which tool worked best this week?
days.habit: Commit to 3 practice days next week.

plans.title: Recovery First: Sleep + Focus for High-Stress Weeks
plans.summary: When sleep is low and stress is high, focus comes from recovery. This plan stabilizes evenings and protects daytime energy.

days.headline: Day 1 — Protect energy
days.meditation: Slow exhale breathing + short body scan.
days.microExercise: Choose 3 priorities only.
days.reflection: What drains my energy fastest?

days.headline: Day 2 — Sleep cues
days.microExercise: Phone out of bed zone.
days.reflection: What time do I start feeling sleepy?

days.headline: Day 3 — Nervous system reset
days.microExercise: 2-minute walk break twice.
days.reflection: What calms me fastest?

days.headline: Day 4 — Focus without strain
days.microExercise: One 25-min focus block, no multitasking.
days.reflection: Which task deserves my best energy?

days.headline: Day 5 — Let thoughts pass
days.microExercise: Brain dump for tomorrow.
days.reflection: What loops at night?

days.headline: Day 6 — Gentle strength
days.microExercise: 10-minute easy walk.
days.reflection: How does movement affect my mind?

days.headline: Day 7 — Recovery plan
days.microExercise: Plan next week’s sleep routine in 3 bullet points.
days.reflection: What worked best for sleep? For focus?
